author: guilhermesalgado9479
content: <@!489256758989029405> I'm curious as to why Nethermind seems to always send a NewBlock msg every time it mines a block, given that https://github.com/ethereum/devp2p/blob/master/caps/eth.md#block-propagation says a NewBlock should be sent only when a node receives it from other peers, or upon request

author: guilhermesalgado9479
content: That seems to be how geth does it as well, though: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/43c278cdf93d5469702fd1c2f570dbf3c1718ff0/eth/handler.go#L894-L902

author: tkstanczak
content:
<@!482518216019542016> Block Propagation
Newly-mined blocks must be relayed to all nodes

author: tkstanczak
content: Miner will send the NewBlock message to all connected nodes to propagate the block as fast as possible.
